text: Bottle: Poured a brown with orange edges with tan. Aroma is tobacco and malt. Taste is wet with dry malt.

Sample, brown bottle, 1 pint 6 ounces, Christmas gathering at Stephen Morriss, savoured on December 18 2015; eye: dirty brown, opaque, minuscule ring of brown head, slight lacing; nose: coffee, espresso, burnt barley; mouth: coffee, espresso, burnt barley, finale in coffee with presence of malt, medium body, average carbonation, a bit thin; overall: fine
 
FRANÇAIS
 
Échantillon, bouteille brune, 1 pinte 6 onces, party de Noël chez Stephen Morris, savourée le 18 décembre 2015; il : brun sale, opaque, minuscule anneau de mousse brune, très légère dentelle; nez : café, expresso, orge brûlée; bouche : café, expresso, orge brulée, finale en café avec présence de malt, corps moyen, carbonatation moyenne, un peu mince; en résumé : bien

650 mL bottle. Brown body. A little transparent. Smells of coffee and nutty malts. Taste is also strong coffee. But the malt is just a bit stronger. Its still a lot of coffee, but just enough malt to back it up. Nutty malts and a bit of bitterness. Light body. Well carbonated. Not my favorite.

Can shared at the 2015 Ottawa Year-end celebration. Copper with a light beige head. Malt forward with some toffee and light caramel, grainy, dried coffee grinds and some musty barley. Moderate carbonation and light body, smooth and easy to drink.

Bottle: Poured a clear light brown color ale with a medium size off-white foamy head with OK retention. Aroma of coffee and hazelnut is pretty interesting. Taste is a nice mix between some hazelnut, some dry floral coffee notes with a light green finish. Body is about average for style with good carbonation. Nice take on a style we see not enough of in North America.

Draft, Pitch black. 3 finger very creamy off white head. Sticky lacing. The aroma is 100% cold brew with cream and a distinct sweet aroma. Good mouthfeel. Creamy with a good sweetness that lingers. The coffee flavor is aggressive up front but it doesnt linger.

Draft at Worth Burger. Almost black in color, mild spotty lace along the snifter. The aroma is fresh roasted coffee beans, mild roasted grain and sugar. The flavor is just coffee forward and bold as the aroma. The body of beer still has the lighter (session) feel without showing any watery character. The coffee lingers in the finish with a dry roasted texture. The Brewer really has something special with a 4.5 % mild ale. Wow

Pours cola, some head and lots of lacing. Nose is tobacco. Flavours tobacco, wet leaves, grain, earthy bitterness and coffee. Taste is light bitter and light sweet. Light body with lively carbonation.

A reddish brown ale with a thin mocha head. In aroma, nutty caramel malt with loads of coffee grind, musty character, burned Caramel, OK. In mouth, a nice sweet caramel malt with light nutty notes, light coffee grind, nice and smooth. Bottle at Ottawa Xmas gathering 2015.

Sample at Three Penny, pours dark brown with small to medium ultra creamy head. Notes of cold brewed coffee, light roasted malt, caramel, toffee, and bread. Very balanced and drinkable mild ale with some nice hops coming through in the finish

Half pour on tap at prohibition pig brewpub. Dark brown almost black pour with lacy tan foam. Aroma is nice and malty, rich caramel toffee notes, very hoppy as well, rich coffee aroma, roasty. Taste is sweet, caramel coffee drink with light grassiness. Palate is med bodied with light carbonation. Tasty stuff.
